law.catch_line: Legislative findings on students' right to quality education.
law.text: The General Assembly declares that all students of the Commonwealth have a right to an appropriate and quality education in the public schools and the right to achieve the capacities under KRS 158.645. The General Assembly challenges all school personnel to take the necessary action to help each individual student complete elementary and secondary school with the capacities to transition successfully to adult life.
law.history: Created 1998 Ky. Acts ch. 514, sec. 1, effective July 15, 1998.
